page.title: 09VIEW OF DANYGRAIG
page.content: DONNA ROBERTS AGED 11 Today our class went for a walk to the top of Kilvey Hill. We took the path that skirted the edge of the Bog and comes out at th back of the hill at Bonymaen. We passed near three farms on our way to the top, farms with cows, chickens and horses. Because of the T.V. mast at the top of the hill, pylons strode like gigantic figures from the edge of the sea to the very summit carrying the electricity needed by the installation at the top. We sat and rested at the summit. Stretched below us was Danygraig, the Docks and the sea. Away on our left was the Baglan Bay Petro_Chemical works and Llandarcy Oil Refinery. All of us must have seen the view many times, but none of us had really taken it in before. The Crymlyn Bog was beautiful in the
